trans-unit.source: Press and hold the remote control's pairing button until the display shows a pairing symbol.

trans-unit.source: Press and hold the streamer's pairing button until the display shows a pairing symbol.
trans-unit.target: Press once, twice or three times on the pairing button on the Streamer or Micro Mic / Multi Mic to select pairing channel. The LED will blink to indicate that the unit is in pairing mode.

trans-unit.source: Fitting data on the instrument(s) appears to be invalid and cannot be read. The instrument(s) will be muted until new fitting data has been successfully saved.

ReSound Aventa is having difficulty reading the currently connected device(s) and will temporarily mute the hearing instrument(s).
To un-mute the instrument(s), select 'OK' then click 'Save' and proceed with programming.

trans-unit.source: This program can be used when in a place that has a teleloop, e.g. churches, theaters and/ or at home watching TV. This program will give the listener the sound directly from the source into the hearing aid combined with sound from the hearing aid’s microphone allowing the user to hear if a person next them talks.
trans-unit.target: This program can be used when in a place that has a teleloop, e.g. churches, theaters and/ or at home watching TV. This program will give the listener the sound directly from the source into the hearing aid combined with sound from the hearing aid's microphone allowing the user to hear if a person next them talks.
BlueTooth To Bridge - Speech Plus Mic

trans-unit.source: Instruments must be assigned to this patient and connected in order to add or remove accessories.
trans-unit.target:
‘Please make sure that the hearing instruments and wireless accessories always run the latest firmware version. If you experience problems when paring accessories to hearing instruments, please check for firmware updates by doing the following.
Accessories: Connect the accessory to your computer using the USB cable supplied with the accessory and run the Accessory Updater Tool from the desktop (installed with the fitting software).
Hearing instruments Connect the hearing instruments to the fitting software and go to the menu Instruments - Update Instruments’
Note: The 1st generation TV streaming device is not compatible with newer hearing instrument families.’

trans-unit.source: The accessory must be in discovery mode in order to be added to the patient. Place the accessory in this mode by following the instructions above.

trans-unit.source:
Please check cables, programming interface, if a battery is required, and that the correct version of Solus is in use.
If you are trying to replace one of the hearing instruments, then select 'Replace Instrument...' button below, then unassign and rediscover.
trans-unit.target:
Insert new batteries, verify instrument configuration, ensure the correct version of ReSound Aventa is in use, check programming interface and cables.
If you are trying to replace the hearing instrument(s), select 'Replace Instrument,' unassign BOTH instruments, click 'Find' and re-assign current instruments.
If you are trying to connect to only one of the hearing instruments, select 'Continue.'

trans-unit.target: Customize the push button on the instrument(s) for multple actions. To test your settings, you will need to save and disconnect the instrument(s).

trans-unit.source: Both instruments have been used more than two years. It may decrease the accuracy of an In-Situ audiometry.
trans-unit.target: Both instruments have been used more than two years. It may decrease the accuracy of an In-Situ audiometry measurement.

trans-unit.source: Left/Right instrument has been used more than two years. It may decrease the accuracy of an In-Situ audiometry.
trans-unit.target: Left/Right instrument has been used more than two years. It may decrease the accuracy of an In-Situ audiometry measurement.

trans-unit.source:
In-Situ audiometry requires a quiet environment in order to be accurate.
Please evaluate the environment to determine the noise level.
trans-unit.target:
In-Situ Audiometry requires a quiet environment in order to be accurate.
Please evaluate the environment to determine the noise level.

trans-unit.source: The environment is too noisy to use In-Situ audiometry. Try moving to a quieter location.
trans-unit.target: The environment is too noisy to use In-Situ Audiometry. Try moving to a quieter location.

trans-unit.source: The environment is noisy to use In-Situ audiometry. Measurements may not be accurate.
trans-unit.target: The environment is noisy to use In-Situ Audiometry. Measurements may not be accurate.

trans-unit.source: At least one device is required
trans-unit.target: At least one instrument is required

trans-unit.source: The ambient noise environment should be supported for at least one device
trans-unit.target: The ambient noise environment should be supported for at least one instrument

trans-unit.source: Instruments are now capable of exceeding 70 dB SPL. Special care should be exercised when fitting these instruments above this level.
trans-unit.target: Instruments are now capable of exceeding 70 dB SPL. Special care should be exercised when fitting these instruments above this level. Note: if the instruments support Nature Sounds; when switching from Nature Sounds to Standard TSG an increase in volume may be noticed.

trans-unit.source: The shaded area shows the sound level and bandwidth for the tinnitus sound generator.
trans-unit.target: The shaded area shows the sound level and bandwidth for the Tinnitus Sound Generator.

trans-unit.source: There are not enough frequencies to perform an accurate fitting. Please measure additional frequencies or import them from a conventional audiogram.
trans-unit.target: There are not enough frequencies to perform an accurate fitting. Three main points are required (250 or 500, 1K, and one point between 2K and 4K). Please measure additional frequencies or import them from a conventional audiogram.

trans-unit.source: The difference between the current and previous In-Situ thresholds is 10dB HL or more.
trans-unit.target: The difference between the current and previous In-Situ thresholds is 10 dB HL or more.

trans-unit.source: An error has occurred with device communication. Unable to continue with In-Situ audiometry.
trans-unit.target: An error has occurred with instrument communication. Unable to continue with In-Situ audiometry.

trans-unit.source: Connected device(s) do not support In-Situ audiometry
trans-unit.target: Connected instrument(s) do not support In-Situ audiometry

trans-unit.target: In-Situ Audiogram has been saved to Database.

trans-unit.source: In-Situ Audiogram and fitting data has been saved to Standalone Database.”
trans-unit.target: In-Situ Audiogram and fitting data has been saved to Standalone Database.

trans-unit.source: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ audiometry it is recommended to use a Power Dome.
trans-unit.target: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ Audiometry it is recommended to use a Power Dome.

trans-unit.source: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ audiometry it is recommended to seal the ventilation in the custom earmold or to use an occluding Comply Tip.
trans-unit.target: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ audiometry it is recommended to seal the vent in the custom earmold or to use an occluding Comply Tip.

trans-unit.source: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ audiometry it is recommended to use a Tulip Dome.
trans-unit.target: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ Audiometry it is recommended to use a Tulip Dome.

trans-unit.source:
We are sorry, the hearing instrument update cannot be completed.
- It is recommended to use a wired connection and retry the update. - Please chose a wired programming interface and re-connect.
trans-unit.target:
The hearing instrument update was unsuccessful.
Please select from the following cabled interfaces and re-connect to instruments.
If the update fails again, please exit and relaunch ReSound Aventa, then restart the update process.

trans-unit.source: At least one selected instrument is different than the saved session. - Press ‘Continue’ to load from the saved session - Press ‘Cancel’ to return to the current session
trans-unit.target: At least one selected instrument is different than the saved session. - Press 'Continue' to display saved session data and proceed in simulation. - Press 'Cancel' to return to the currently connected instruments. An initial fit will be calculated.

trans-unit.source: The In-Situ audiogram used in the previous fitting on the {0} instrument(s) has been modified. Selecting “OK” will recalculate the fitting data based on the conventional audiogram data
trans-unit.target: The In-Situ Audiogram used in the previous fitting on the {0} instrument(s) has been modified. Selecting “OK” will recalculate the fitting data based on the conventional audiogram data

trans-unit.source: The wireless products does not support the same set of accessories to fit them as binaural.
trans-unit.target: A wireless instrument supporting all accessories cannot be fitted together with a wireless instrument only supporting the Remote Control accessory.

trans-unit.source: Error saving REM data to Noah.
trans-unit.target: Error saving REM data to Database.

trans-unit.source:
There is a new algorithm package available for the instrument(s), including new features and end user benefits, and can be updated in Fuse at this time. Please be aware that duration of the update depends on the programming interface used. The update may take several minutes. No instrument data will be lost during update.
For fastest instrument update, use Speedlink or NOAHlink. Do not interrupt the update once it has begun. Inserting a fresh battery before updating is recommended.
Would you like to update now?
trans-unit.target:
There is a new algorithm package available for the instrument(s).
A cabled connection is recommended and fresh batteries are required to perform the update.
Do not interrupt the update once it has begun.
Would you like to update now?

trans-unit.source:
The instrument(s) contain different algorithm packages and cannot be programmed simultaneously until the older algorithm package is updated in Fuse. Please be aware that duration of the update depends on the programming interface used. The update may take several minutes. No instrument data will be lost during update.
For fastest instrument update, use Speedlink or NOAHlink. Do not interrupt the update once it has begun. Inserting a fresh battery before updating is recommended.
Would you like to update now?
trans-unit.target:
ONE OF THE HEARING INSTRUMENTS CONNECTED NEEDS TO BE UPDATED IN ORDER TO PROGRAM BINAURALLY.
A cabled connection is recommended and fresh batteries are required to perform the update. Do not interrupt the update once it has begun.
Would you like to update now?

trans-unit.source: The instrument has been successfully restored to factory settings. The instrument has also been updated with the newest algorithm package, including new features and end user benefits.
trans-unit.target: The instrument has been successfully restored. The instrument has also been updated with the newest algorithm package, including new features and end user benefits.
ReSound Aventa AutoREM Real Ear Measurement

trans-unit.source: The Connection To Noah Failed - Aventa Will Now Exit
trans-unit.target: ReSound Aventa cannot load the NOAH patient. Please restart Aventa and try again.

trans-unit.source: An error has occurred with initializing AutoREM. Unable to continue.
trans-unit.target: An error has occurred with initializing AutoREM. Unable to continue.

trans-unit.source: Spatial Directionality takes advantage of the full power of the brain and creates a more natural listening experience. Allowing both an omnidirectional and a directional signal provides the auditory system with optimum input which enables the hearing instrument wearer to be aware of all sounds and speech at the same time. As the conversation starts behind the hearing instrument user, he is able to change focus to the more interesting conversation occurring behind him. By having the ability to consciously choose the listening source in which he is interested, the user is no longer limited by the directional system of the hearing aid or by manual adjustments.
trans-unit.target: Natural Directionality II takes advantage of the full power of the brain and creates a more natural listening experience. Allowing both an omnidirectional and a directional signal provides the auditory system with optimum input which enables the hearing instrument wearer to be aware of all sounds and speech at the same time. As the conversation starts behind the hearing instrument user, he is able to change focus to the more interesting conversation occurring behind him. By having the ability to consciously choose the listening source in which he is interested, the user is no longer limited by the directional system of the hearing aid or by manual adjustments.

trans-unit.source: Without Feedback Eraser activated, sounds coming from the hearing instrument receiver loop back to the microphones, creating a risk for whistling and squealing.
trans-unit.target: Without DFS Ultra II activated, sounds coming from the hearing instrument receiver loop back to the microphones, creating a risk for whistling and squealing.

trans-unit.source: The Feedback Eraser system uses a digital filter to suppress feedback without reducing the gain of the hearing instrument. The hearing instrument wearer is able to hear her spouse without annoying whistling sounds.
trans-unit.target: The DFS Ultra II system uses a digital filter to suppress feedback without reducing the gain of the hearing instrument. The hearing instrument wearer is able to hear her spouse without annoying whistling sounds.

trans-unit.source: When patient changes program on one instrument, the other side will change to be the same program.
trans-unit.target: When patient changes program on one instrument, the other side will change to the same program.

trans-unit.source: When patient changes the volume on one instrument, the other side will synchronize with the same volume changes.
trans-unit.target: When patient changes the volume on one instrument, the other side will synchronize volume changes.

trans-unit.source: Ear-to-Ear volume change synchronization is turned off. Please set volume change of the multi-function button identical on both sides.
trans-unit.target: Ear-to-Ear volume change synchronization is turned off. Please set volume change of the multi-function button identically on both sides.

trans-unit.source: Ear-to-Ear volume change synchronization is turned off. Please set volume change of the multi-function button identical on both sides.
trans-unit.target: Ear-to-Ear volume change synchronization is turned off. Please set volume change of the multi-function button identically on both sides.

trans-unit.source: Modulation, Speed, and Sound Level Adjustment settings need to be identical on both sides in order to enable synchronization. Which do you want to use for both sides?
trans-unit.target: Synchronized TSG requires identical Amplitude modulation, Modulation speed and Volume Control settings in each instrument.

trans-unit.source: Each instrument independently identifies its own environment.
Selected instruments have ear-to-ear capability and can automatically detect and switch focus ear in real time when appropriate. P1 will be changed to Natural Directionality II environment.
trans-unit.target: P1 will be changed to a Binaural Directionality environment

trans-unit.target: Remote Control is not working with the hearing instrument (s).

trans-unit.target: Replace the batteries in the Remote Control

trans-unit.source: Re-pair the Remote Control to the hearing instruments
trans-unit.target: Re-pair the Remote Control to the hearing instruments

trans-unit.target: Attempt to hold the Remote Control within the recommended distance to the hearing instruments, 60 inches (150 cm)

trans-unit.target: If Remote Control was updated with new firmware the hearing instruments may also need an update

trans-unit.target: TV streamer is not functioning: The user does not hear sound from the TV streamer, or only hears sound out of one ear

trans-unit.source: Ensure the TV streamer is paired to the hearing instruments, and that it is correctly connected to the television
trans-unit.target: Ensure the TV streamer is paired to the hearing instruments, and that it is correctly connected to the television

trans-unit.source: Ask the user if the television has a digital or analog output. If it is a digital output an adaptor may be required.
trans-unit.target: Ask the user if the television has a digital or analog output. If it is a digital output an adaptor may be required.

trans-unit.source: Ensure user is in streaming mode while using the instrument.
trans-unit.target: Ensure user is in streaming mode while using the instrument.

trans-unit.source: If only hearing sound from one ear, change the setting on the back of the streamer from "s" to "m" or vice versa.
trans-unit.target: If only hearing sound from one ear, change the setting on the back of the streamer from "s" to "m" or vice versa.

trans-unit.target: Micro Mic / Multi Mic is too noisy

trans-unit.source: Make certain the Micro Mic / Multi Mic is not covered by clothing.
trans-unit.target: Make certain the Micro Mic / Multi Mic is not covered by clothing.

trans-unit.target: Increase the volume of the Phone Clip.

trans-unit.target: Turn off the synchronization function for volume control

trans-unit.target: Available in the Advanced Features on applicable programs. If turned on, SoftSwitching will be synchronized in both ears

trans-unit.source: Available in the PhoneNow program. If turned on, the PhoneNow program detects when the user holds a phone to their ear and automatically adjusts settings in both hearing instruments.
trans-unit.target: Available in the PhoneNow program. If turned on, the PhoneNow program detects when the user holds a phone to their ear and automatically provides emphasis to the phone ear by reducing gain in the non-phone ear to focus more fully on telephone conversations.

trans-unit.target: The connected instruments are not the same as the ones saved in database

trans-unit.source: Place the module on the patient’s ear while patient is facing the speaker. Fold the probe tube over placing the tube opening in front of the reference microphone.
trans-unit.target: Place the module on the patient’s ear while patient is facing the speaker. Bend the probe tube and place the tube opening in front of the reference microphone.

trans-unit.source: Place the probe tube in the patient’s ear canal without the hearing instruments on the ears. For best measurements the probe tube tip should no farther than 6mm from the ear drum.
trans-unit.target: Place the probe tube in the patient’s ear canal without the hearing instruments on the ears. For best measurements the probe tube tip should be no farther than 6mm from the ear drum.

trans-unit.source: Select “Apply” to use these measurements to fit to target. If window is closed without “Apply” the current real ear data will be lost.
trans-unit.target: Select “Gain View” display option to view final gain curves for the selected input levels. Select “Accuracy View” display option to view final deviations from target. Select “Apply” to use these measurements to fit to target. If window is closed without “Apply” the current real ear data will be lost.

trans-unit.source: Manage Program Names - Remote Control Programs
Program name does not meet minimum length
trans-unit.target: Program name is too short. Minimum length must be 3 characters.

trans-unit.source: Program names over 10 characters may be truncated
trans-unit.target: Program names over 10 characters may be truncated.

trans-unit.source: When microphone modes are calculated automatically for products that support Binaural Directionality

Binaural Directionality takes into account that the hearing instruments you are wearing communicate with each other. Depending on where from the input signals come, the directionality mode can change from one ear to another.
trans-unit.target: Binaural Directionality uses information that is exchanged by the hearing instruments you are wearing. Depending on the mix of speech and noise and the location of the speech, the directionality mode will change. This will ensure the best listening conditions in all situations. Binaural Directionality allows you to focus on someone speaking but still be able to hear other sounds in your surroundings.

trans-unit.source: Natural Directionality provides all the benefits of Adaptive Directionality with the additional benefit of allowing the wearer to have constant awareness of the surrounding sound environment. Consequently the sound source of interest is based on the user’s conscious listening decision – not the limitation of the directional system.
trans-unit.target: Natural Directionality allows you to have constant awareness of the surrounding sound environment. Consequently the sound source of interest is based on your conscious listening decision.

trans-unit.source: This feature uses an environmental classifier to determine the different environments in which the hearing instrument user is in. Volume is automatically optimized to the user’s needs and comfort in all environments. This will ensure optimal comfort in all environments.
trans-unit.target: The Environmental Optimizer II recognizes what type of listening environment you are in, and automatically adjusts the volume and the amount of noise reduction for optimum listening comfort and sound quality.

trans-unit.source: Automatically adjusts the degree of focus.
trans-unit.target: This feature adjusts level of directional focus, depending on the location of the speaker of interest and the surrounding sound. If there is only one person speaking in front of you, without other sounds interfering, the focus is narrowed. If there are multiple sources of sound, coming from the side or from the back, the focus is broadened.

trans-unit.source: Noise Reduction is a fast-acting system which differentiates speech from noise across multiple bands. Precise technology reduces annoying microphone and background noise without loss of speech quality. The result is increased comfort and less listening fatigue in both quiet and noisy environments.
trans-unit.target: NoiseTracker II reduces unwanted background noise without affecting the quality of speech. This gives you increased listening comfort in all types of listening environments.

trans-unit.source: This system uses a wind noise detector that actively monitors the input signal for air-flow turbulence. When the wind noise detector determines that the signal has air-flow turbulence that may cause annoyance and speech masking, a filter is applied to reduce the amount of amplification for the low frequencies where wind noise occurs.
trans-unit.target: WindGuard senses when wind is present and reduces the level of noise caused by the wind blowing on the hearing instruments. This provides better listening comfort in outdoor environments.

trans-unit.source: Expansion reduces the hissing that can sometimes be heard with hearing instruments in very quiet environments. A typical scenario would be when you hear the noise from your refrigerator. The higher level of expansion, the more unwanted low-level noise is eliminated.
trans-unit.target: Expansion reduces the hissing that can sometimes be heard with hearing instruments in very quiet environments. A typical scenario would be when you hear the noise from your refrigerator. The higher level of expansion, the more unwanted low-level noise is eliminated.

trans-unit.source: Feedback is the unwanted whistling or buzzing noise that a hearing instrument can make. Modern feedback suppression methods continually monitor the incoming signal and adjust the hearing instrument to minimize feedback without reducing gain. The system monitors feedback, creating an inverted phase signal to eliminate the problem before it becomes audible. The result is more gain from the instrument without embarrassing whistling. This enables the wearer to hold objects such as a telephone close to the hearing instrument without disturbing feedback interference.
trans-unit.target: Feedback is the unwanted whistling or buzzing noise that a hearing instrument can make. DFS Ultra II cancels feedback, resulting in clear sound without embarrassing whistling. It also prevents whistling when you hold a phone or your hand up to your ear. DFS Ultra II includes a special Music Mode that is optimized to provide the best sound quality for music listening.

trans-unit.source: Sound Shaper increases your audibility in the higher frequencies.
trans-unit.target: A primary goal of fitting amplification is to provide access to as much speech information as possible, for improving audibility of high frequency sounds is frequency lowering. This term refers to sound processing strategies that move information from higher frequency areas to lower frequency areas, where audibility is better. The idea behind frequency lowering is that audibility of these sounds even at “misplaced” frequencies is more beneficial than no audibility at all.

trans-unit.source: It is common for those with severe-to-profound losses to rely on even more low frequency gain than prescribed by the fitting rationale. To accommodate this need, Low Frequency Boost provides a quick way to increase low frequency gain in three discrete steps to enhance audibility, loudness, and fullness of sound quality for these individuals.
trans-unit.target: It is common for those with severe-to-profound hearing loss to rely on even more low frequency gain than prescribed by the fitting rationale. To accommodate this need, Low Frequency Boost provides a quick way to increase low frequency gain in three discrete steps to enhance audibility, loudness, and fullness of sound quality for these individuals.

trans-unit.source: The acceptance manager allows for acclimatization to amplification, particularly for first time hearing instrument users. Many new hearing instrument users prefer less gain than what is prescribed for them. This feature enables the hearing instrument to gradually change gain, compression and the frequency response as the instrument is worn, allowing for greater acceptance of amplification.
trans-unit.target: It can sometimes be difficult to get used to new hearing instruments. The Acceptance Manager slowly adjusts the gain to the optimum setting for your hearing loss over a period of time where you are wearing the hearing instruments. This allows you to gradually adjust to your new hearing instruments.

trans-unit.source: People often prefer more bass sound when listening to music or television. Streamer bassboost applies more bass to sounds that are streamed from ReSound Unite wireless accessories for the best sound quality.
trans-unit.target: People often prefer more bass sound when listening to music or television. Streamer bassboost applies more bass to sounds that are streamed from ReSound wireless accessories for the best sound quality.

trans-unit.source: When you change volume or programs on one side, Device-to-Device communication ensures that the change automatically happens on the other side as well.
trans-unit.target: When you change volume or programs on one side, Ear-to-Ear communication ensures that the change automatically happens on the other side as well.

trans-unit.source: Testing not advised. To accurately perform In-Situ audiometry it is recommended to use a Pressure dome.
trans-unit.target: Testing not advised. Please be aware with venting and open domes you cannot measure low frequencies. To accurately perform In-Situ audiometry across the frequency range, it is recommended to use a Power dome.

trans-unit.source: Stereo is enabled 'On' during a binaural fitting, when the same Natural Sound is selected for both instruments and e2e for TSG is active
trans-unit.target: Stereo is enabled 'On' during a binaural fitting, when 1. the same Nature Sound is selected for both instruments and 2. ear to ear communication for TSG is active

trans-unit.source: The Natural Sound Level may not equal a negative value
trans-unit.target: The Nature Sound Level may not equal a negative value

trans-unit.source: * Items with asterisk impact both Standard TSG and Natural Sounds
trans-unit.target: * Items with asterisk impact both Standard TSG and Nature Sounds

trans-unit.source: Do you want to refit hearing instrument(s) with the changed frequently used environments?
trans-unit.target: Do you want to refit the hearing instrument(s) with the changed frequently used environments?

trans-unit.source: The following settings impact both Standard TSG and Natural Sounds
trans-unit.target: The following settings impact both Standard TSG and Nature Sounds

trans-unit.source:
In addition to using the D2D wireless link to determine the best directionality mode for the environment, Binauaral Directionality II introduces pinna restoration and bilateral compression to provide for more natural sound processing.
Pinna restoration allows for directivity that mimics the way the natural ear treats sound. This helps you with both speech understanding and sound localization.
Bilateral compression aids in preserving the natural loudness differences between the ears. The D2D wireless link ensures that there is minimal impact on the spatial information when sound is processed through the hearing instruments.
Binaural Directionality II is designed to be as transparent as possible in order to maximize the positive effects of spatial hearing and facilitate listening in noisy environments.
trans-unit.target:
In addition to using the ear-to-ear wireless link to determine the best directionality mode for the environment, Binauaral Directionality II introduces pinna restoration and bilateral compression to provide for more natural sound processing when both instruments switch to omni directional mode.
Pinna restoration allows for directivity that mimics the way the natural ear treats sound. This helps you with both speech understanding and sound localization.
Bilateral compression aids in preserving the natural loudness differences between the ears. The Ear-to-Ear wireless link ensures that there is minimal impact on the spatial information when sound is processed through the hearing instruments.
Binaural Directionality II is designed to be as transparent as possible in order to maximize the positive effects of spatial hearing and facilitate listening in noisy environments.

trans-unit.source: Natural Sounds use the natural modulation characteristics of real life environmental sounds. Each Natural Sound is modulated to mimic the corresponding environmental setting. For example, the natural modulation characteristic of waves breaking on rocks is different than that of calm waves in the ocean. By selecting Natural Sounds you are providing the user with a calming, comfortable sound experience as an alternative to traditional white noise. The Natural Sound selected should be determined by user preference, as therapeutic sounds for tinnitus have great individual variance.
trans-unit.target: Nature Sounds use the natural modulation characteristics of real life environmental sounds. Each Nature Sounds option is modulated to mimic the corresponding environmental setting. For example, the natural modulation characteristic of waves breaking on rocks is different than that of calm waves in the ocean. By selecting a Nature Sounds stimulus you are providing the user with a calming, comfortable sound experience as an alternative to traditional white noise. The sound selected should be determined by user preference, as therapeutic sounds for tinnitus have great individual variance.

trans-unit.source: Selecting a vent or dome option does not change the acoustic performance of the instrument receiver. The vent effect shown in the gain screen is an estimate of the output in the ear.
trans-unit.target: Vent Configuration will not affect the output of the hearing instrument. Selecting a Vent Configuration option will only impact the view of the estimated insertion gain. Check the Vent Correction box in the Fit Screen to view the estimated effect of selected vent configurations.

trans-unit.source: Please Open/Close Battery Door to place the instrument in discovery mode.
trans-unit.target: Please Open/Close the battery door to place instrument in discovery mode

trans-unit.source: Notice: You now have multiple programs and the HI push button is not configured to switch between programs. To enable this, go to the Beeps & Volume Control page.
trans-unit.target: Notice: You now have multiple programs and the HI push button is not configured to switch between programs. To enable this, go to the Beeps & Volume Control page.
Change directionality to Binaural Directionality II

trans-unit.source: use wireless device or accessory to stream preferred stimulus
trans-unit.target: Use wireless device or accessory to stream preferred audio

trans-unit.source: Spatial Hearing Lite Desc Goes Here
trans-unit.target: Spatial Sense is an omnidirectional listening mode designed to maximize the positive effects of spatial hearing. Spatial Sense consists of pinna restoration and bilateral compression to provide for more natural sound processing. Pinna restoration allows for directivity that mimics the way the natural ear treats sound. This helps you with both speech understanding and sound localization. Bilateral compression is introduced to preserve the natural loudness differences between the ears.

trans-unit.source: With the use of D2D communication, the Comfort Phone feature automatically reduces the gain on the non-phone ear. This feature allows the instrument user the ability to comfortably hear their phone conversation while reducing the competing environmental noise. This reduction in gain is automatically built into the Phone Now functionality when the D2D communication is enabled.
trans-unit.target: With the use of Ear-to-Ear communication, the Comfort Phone feature automatically reduces the gain on the non-phone ear. This feature allows the instrument user the ability to comfortably hear their phone conversation while reducing the competing environmental noise. This reduction in gain is automatically built into the Phone Now functionality when the D2D communication is enabled.

trans-unit.source: A portable voice and sound streamer for people on the go. Streams the voice of the conversation partner – or sound from any audio device – directly to the hearing instruments within a range of at least 7 meters.
trans-unit.target:
RESOUND MICRO MIC Extremely easy to use, the Micro Mic pairs to any wireless ReSound hearing aid in seconds. When your client clips it on to the clothing of the person they want to hear, they can enjoy conversation even in background noise. With a range of up to 25 metres in clear line of sight, the Micro Mic is ideal for use on shopping trips, in busy cafes or for talking in the car.
RESOUND MULTI MIC The Multi Mic can do everything the Micro Mic can. But placed horizontally on the table, its automatically switches into a mode optimized for picking up the voices of multiple speakers. The Multi Mic also connects to FM (FM receiver required) and loop systems, and has a mini-jack input for streaming audio from virtually any device with a headphones output.
To continue, select instruments for the current fitting.

trans-unit.target: Calibration was cancelled. DFS calibration is recommended and required to select the level of DFS in Advanced Features

trans-unit.target: The program environments were migrated to the ‘All-Around’ program environment. If the program is defaulted to fixed or Adaptive directionality, it will be changed to SoftSwitching

trans-unit.target: The PIN code you provided is incorrect. If you continue, the connected instrument(s) will not be read and will be initial fitted. Click back to re-enter the correct PIN code.
